results.title: Production of commercial gramophonic discs
results.creator_credit: P.J. Brook and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at the various processes involved in the making of a record - from the artists recording onto multi-track tapes, through to the marketing and distribution to the public. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Islands in the stream
results.creator_credit: Paramount Communications, Peter Bart, Max Palewsky and Franklin J. Schaffner
results.brief_description: Abridged version of Hemingway’s novel. An artist living alone on his island retreat is visited by his sons. Over the summer, he discovers their mutual need and respect. (This section, however, is not representative of the theme of the novel as a whole). Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mahatma and the mad boy
results.creator_credit: Merchant Ivory Productions and Ismail Merchant
results.brief_description: A comment on poverty and wealth filmed in Bombay, the central characters being the “mad” boy, his monkey and a statue of Mahatma Ghandi. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Granny lives in Galway
results.brief_description: An excerpt from the film ‘Fligh of the Doves’, focusing on a story about a brother and sister who escape from a cruel stepfather in England and search for their grandmother who lives in a cottage in Galway, Ireland. Based on the book by Walter Macken.

results.title: Hector's roadshow
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Humour and fantasy are employed to convey an essential road safety message to young children. Kerb drill, bicycle safety and the use of seat belts are emphasized in this zany pantomine. Cast: Tony Strachan and Greg Temple. Cinematographer/Director of Photography: Edwin Scragg.

results.title: The Rocking horse winner
results.creator_credit: William Deneen, Peter Medak, Learning Corporation of America and Highgate Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classics Dark and Dangerous”.
Adapted from a novel by D.H. Lawrence about a young boy whose rocking horse empowers him to predict winning racehorses at the eventual cost of his life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Breaking out of The Doll's House
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Joseph Losey
results.brief_description: This film is edited from the feature film “The Doll’s House” which is an adaptation of the play by Ibsen, written in 1879. Jane Fonda plays the role of the main character Nora. A series of events in Nora’s married life forces her to turn back on her family and search for her own identity. This film raises discussion on the issues of feminine identity and is recommended for Years 11-12.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Learning Corporation of America and Joseph Losey
